user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
I love Benefit Cosmetics, so I was excited when I ordered this blush. When it came in the mail, I looked beautiful with the packaging and had vivid colors. However, the product wasn’t pigmented nor shiny at all when I applied it, as I would have expected. Yes, it is pink, but not that much and the color was sheer. It looked natural, but I needed to put a lot on even if I just wanted that kind of effect. One good thing, though: you don’t need a full size product, if you have multiple blushes like me! It lasts a very long time, as it is a pressed blush. However, I won’t repurchase again because I was disappointed, even if I decided to give their pressed blushes a second chance after the Dandelion came out looking dull on me.

review_content:

review_title: Galifornia- Another good one from Benefit!
review_content:
I’m a big fan of the Benefit Blush Boxes in general- I have nearly every shade. I first bought the mini of this shade (Galifornia) because I figured I didn’t need another full-sized blush that I’ll never finish. I love it- each such a pretty pink with a golden sheen to it. However- I heard a rumor that the mini size version is different in color to the full sized, so I picked the full size Uo during the last sale and... turns out that it is! The full size does have a gold overspray that comes off after a use or two- but it in general has a more golden color to it than the mini. It’s still pink and bright- just I bit more “oomf”. I really like this shade! It’s sooo pretty for a summery, healthy flush to the cheeks!

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
I’ve had this blush for a little while and have just rediscovered it. I wasn’t getting much pigment the first couple of months I was using it, which made it a good blush for work where I don’t want to have obvious makeup on. I tried it on recently after giving it a break and holy moly at the pigment it was giving me. I don’t know if I had gotten past some hard-pan or what, but it turned into a very sexy “I was just outside” flush. Swatch yours every now and then to test the pigment so you’re getting an accurate pigment, or try a few different blush brushes with it. My current brush has very dense bristles so that could be another factor (although it’s the same one I always use). The color is probably one of my favorites ever along with Rockateur. It’s the perfect spring/summer pop of coral-pink that can amp up a natural look in minutes. Also, I want to bathe in whatever they’ve scented this in lol. It smells like all the good parts of sunscreen to me.

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Oily', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Hazel']
review_content:
First - be warned! - the travel size IS NOT the same color as the full size The travel size is way more orange and has a completely different texture - super powdery and crumbly to the touch. The full size is more peachy pink and smooth. The gold overspray will be gone after the first use - honestly, I fluffed my brush around in the box to get rid of the overspray before I used it the first time. The color is a beautiful pinky peach flush, very easy to blend, and wore well for the entire work day. I was extremely hesitant to pick up the full size, especially after hating the travel size so much. But I'm glad I made the swap.

this is the perfect year round blush for any skin tone! the color blends beautifully and even though the shimmer is only on top- it is great with or without. highly recommend plus the smell is fantastic!

If you're buying the mini thinking it's the same as the full size, think again. The blushes are 2 different colors, go into your local store and swatch them side by side. The full size Galifornia is a pinky coral with a sheen whereas the mini is a matte orange blush. Not sure why no one mentions this but people may be purchasing the mini to save money thinking they're the same. I'm not saying the mini is a bad blush but it's not anything like the full size which is the better purchase, in my opinion.

This is wonderful. It is a perfect color for me.

The colour is such a pretty pink and it smells amazing!! I bought this after returning another more expensive blush and I'm so happy I did! Only thing is I wish there was gold throughout the blush and not just the gold sun on the top because it goes away after one use but still in love!
I love everything about this blush...it's a perfect shade for me which is hard to find considering I have freckles
The packaging is cute and I like the color, but I'm disappointed in the size. I expected it to be bigger and this size honestly isn't worth $15
I always thought I couldn't pull off a pink like this but it looks great and stays really well!
The packaging is THE cutest of all the boxed powders. It smells so good, but not too strong. The color goes on natural and can be built up easily. Love love love this amazing blush! You need it!

user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Skin Type Dry', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content: I really like this color. Its pigmented, but forgiving, when I use a heavy hand, and I have light medium skin color. I notice that it lasts a bit longer than my other blushes.
Beautiful color, I had trouble finding a blush that fit my medium skin tone. This is it ladies! I highly recommend it. It really brings out your makeup and even looks natural.

I bought the little one because I was unsure of the color. I'm very fair with a cool undertone. This makes me look slightly sunburned and it has some shimmer to it. If I don't put a lot on it works but I just wasn't expecting so much shimmer. Definitely go in stores and see for yourself before you buy!!
This blush is awesome...like all the benefit blushes I've tried! I LOVE LOVE the color & the way it looks on my cheeks! I will be purchasing the full size as soon as I run out of the travel size...

I am absolutely in love with this blush! It's so pretty! I fell in love with the packaging and scent. It's like summer in a box- the sunkissed flush, the gold shimmers, the beachy scent. I know it bothers some people that the gold sun design goes away after a few uses, but it didn't bother me at all. I actually purchased the travel size, which doesn't have the gold sun, and ended up purchasing the bigger size because I loved the color so much. It's the perfect bright peachy pink. I have light-medium skin, and it looks really natural. It looks great when I do and don't have foundation on. You can use a little bit to get a wash of color, or you can go heavier to get a I-was-at-the-beach-all-day flush.

This blush is gorgeous!! I'm so surprised the reviews aren't better. I wear my makeup for at least 8 hours a day and my blush is definitely still there by the end of the day. It is a gorgeous color. The gold shimmer comes off after one brush swipe but I personally don't care for a shimmery blush seeing as shimmer only enhances texture. This blush smells amazing. It is perfect for light, no makeup days and for intense makeup days. I am pretty tan and think it looks best on similar skin tone.

I love the color, however, it doesn't last very long on the skin even with a setting spray

This is a nice blush. Nothing that blows me away. It's my first benefit blush, and I find it doesn't last any longer than drugstore. I was expecting long lasting like tarte, as my hoola bronzer is my favourite for that. The colour is really nice, but something you could find in any other brand. I saw some people say it's too dark for their fair skin, well I'm as white as they come and with a very light hand it looks great. One let down was the colour was much nicer the first use with the gold overlay mixed in. I knew buying it that it was just an overlay, but it would have been nice to have the gold incorporated in the whole blush. I think the mini is definitely worth it, unfortunately I bought this before the mini was available.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I'm giving this 5 stars because it's very bright, very highly pigmented, and a little goes a very long way. But... I'm returning this. Why? I am very pale. On me, even the faintest application turned out bright orange. Beware if pale!
